physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was diagnosed with acromegaly and had a 10-mm pituitary adenoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-surgery, the patient had a decrease in GH levels (from 9.0 /H9262g/liter to 6.2 /H9262g/liter), indicating partial efficacy of the surgery.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: GH: 6.3 /H9262g/liter, IGF-1: 80 nmol/liter, Insulin: 7.2 /H9262U/ml (during octreotide LAR 20 mg therapy)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No modification in GH and IGF-I levels during octreotide treatment. Insulin levels did not change.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 6 months on octreotide therapy, nor tumor shrinkage was observed, leading to therapy interruption.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: GH: 4.1 /H9262g/liter, IGF-1: 48 nmol/liter, Insulin: 9.4 /H9262U/ml (during cabergoline therapy)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Clear reduction of GH and IGF-I levels after 6 months of cabergoline treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates improvement in hormonal levels following the initiation of cabergoline treatment.
